chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Repeater] and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Repeater]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Repeater] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Repeater] was dismissed by the court.

  • Urian Morris Robertson was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Shall receive 88 days presentence credit should supervision be revoked
on any vehicle owned and/or operated by Defendant.

Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.  Defendant shall successfully attend an OWI Victim Impact Panel within 120 days of conviction.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.

timeConds.notes: Consecutive to: with work release and transfer privileges

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Urian Morris Robertson in court, in custody with attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke.  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court questions def and reviews chgs and pens.  Guilty plea entered to count 1 of the information;  count 2 is dismissed and counts 3-5 are DRI.  Court accepts plea and finds defendant guilty.  Defendant's mother sworn and makes statement.  Defendant's cousin sworn and makes statement.  Parties heard on sentencing recomendation.  Defendant makes stmt.  Court heard and imposes sentence as follows:

Sentence w/held - 3 yrs probation
7 mos DCJ as COP effective immed. w/huber
88 days credit if revoked
$600 fine + costs
36 mos revocation and ignition interlock
AODA
Maintain absolute sobriety
Provide DNA Sample
BAC .10

Per post office card

8:38. Defendant, Urian Morris Robertson, in court, in custody with Attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke.  Attorney James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Review of info is waived; not guilty plea entered; 10 days mtns; stc set; bail con't  Telephone scheduling conference scheduled for July 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Urian Morris Robertson
Current: 1721 Blossom Ln, Unit #1, Madison, WI 53716   (Effective: 05-18-2015)
Prior: 1701 Blossom Ln 1, Madison, WI 53716

Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.  Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without permission from this Court.  The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.

1:04 - Defendant Urian Morris Robertson in court, in custody with attorney Jessica M. Moeller (eligible).  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. New address: 1721 Blossom Lane, Unit #1, Madison 53716. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested, within time limits. Prelim set. Court sets $50,000 Cash bond with conditions:   Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without permission from this Court.  Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.  Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.   The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
